meanings.definition: To formulate or express in a different way.
meanings.sent1: She tried to reformulate her idea to make it easier to understand.
meanings.sent2: I need to reformulate my answer to the question.
meanings.sent3: He decided to reformulate his joke to make it funnier.
meanings.sent4: The artist had to reformulate her vision to fit the new gallery space.
meanings.sent5: In order to pass the test, he had to reformulate his study notes.

meanings.definition: To change or revise the formulation of something.
meanings.sent1: The company had to reformulate their product due to new regulations.
meanings.sent2: It is necessary to reformulate the strategy for better results.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to reformulate the recipe after running out of an ingredient.
meanings.sent4: The team had to reformulate their plan when unexpected obstacles arose.
meanings.sent5: To improve efficiency, they decided to reformulate the workflow.
